## Overview
---
This week's TidyTuesday challenge focused on [DATASET_DESCRIPTION]. I explored [KEY_INSIGHTS] using r to [VISUALIZATION_APPROACH], asking **do specific agencies tend to attract certain types of art materials?**

My visualization for this challenge was specifically influenced by CÃ©dric Scherer's contribution to the 2020 week 12 challenge (find it [here](https://github.com/z3tt/TidyTuesday/blob/main/R/2020_12_TheOffice.Rmd)), in which he visualized ratings of The Office.

## Plotting
---

```{r}
#| label: main-plot
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 8
#| warning: false

# Create the main visualization

# evolution of materials in art debuts by different agencies over time
# 6 line plots, vertically (axes flipped) with year on the y, agency groupings on x
# coloring points by material - requires a bit of configuration with regex
# interactive to have points reflect art descriptions?

mta_art %>%
  group_by(agency) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = agency, y = art_date), color = agency) +
  geom_line()

```
